Hey, A-Hole I have proof that vaccines are vile and ineffective so read up dum dum because Some physicians believe thimerosal, an organic mercury compound found in trace amounts in one flu vaccine for children and other vaccines for adults, is linked to autism. Aluminum is used in some vaccines and excess aluminum in human bodies can cause neurological harm. Formaldehyde, also found in some vaccines, is a carcinogen, and, according to VaxTruth.org, exposure can cause side effects such as cardiac impairment, central nervous system depression, "changes in higher cognitive functions," coma, convulsions, and death. Glutaraldehyde, a compound used to disinfect medical and dental equipment, is used in some DTaP vaccinations and exposure can cause asthma and other respiratory issues. Some flu vaccines contain cetyltrimethylammonium bromide (CTMB), a compound used as an antiseptic, which can be a skin, eye, and respiratory irritant. Some polio, TD, and DTaP vaccines contain 2-phenoxyethanol, an antibacterial that is a skin and eye irritant that can cause headaches, shock, convulsions, kidney damage, cardiac and kidney failure, and death. Some vaccines for the flu contain chicken egg protein, which can be harmful to children who are allergic to eggs. Some vaccines for PCV, HPV, DTaP, Hep A, Hep B, and Hib contain yeast proteins which, according to VaxTruth and Joseph Mercola, MD, an alternative medicine proponent, contain MSG that can cause migraines, irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), asthma, diabetes, Alzheimer’s, Lou Gehrig’s disease, ADD, seizure, stroke and According to the CDC, all vaccines carry a risk of a life-threatening allergic reaction (anaphylaxis) in about one per million children. The rotavirus vaccination can cause intussusception, a type of bowel blockage that may require hospitalization, in about one per 20,000 babies in the United States. [49] Long-term seizures, coma, lowered consciousness, and permanent brain damage may be associated with the DTaP (diphtheria, tetanus, and pertussis) and MMR vaccines, though the CDC notes the rarity of the reaction makes it difficult to determine causation. The CDC reports that pneumonia can be caused by the chickenpox vaccine, and a "small possibility" exists that the flu vaccine could be associated with Guillain-Barré Syndrome, a disorder in which the person’s immune system attacks parts of the peripheral nervous system, in about one or two per million people vaccinated. The National Vaccine Information Center (NVIC) says that vaccines may be linked to learning disabilities, asthma, autism, diabetes, chronic inflammation, and other disabilities. Yet listen to this, medical decisions for children should be left to the parents or caregivers. Barbara Loe Fisher, Co-founder of National Vaccine Information Center, stated, "If the State can tag, track down and force citizens against their will to be injected with biological products of known and unknown toxicity today, there will be no limit on which individual freedoms the State can take away in the name of the greater good tomorrow." Ron Paul, MD, former US Representative (R-TX), stated, "intimately personal medical decisions should not be made by government… Freedom over one’s physical person is the most basic freedom of all, and people in a free society should be sovereign over their own bodies. When we give the government the power to make medical decisions for us, we, in essence, accept that the state owns our bodies.

If I know how I'll die, I'll spend my whole life trying to prevent my death, and I'll live in fear of doing the thing that causes my death because I don't know if I'll be alive after I do it. If I know when I die but not how, I'll be far more content, because I won't know what kills me, I'll only know when. This means that I'll be trying to live a full, happy life before my end, though if my killer is a disease such as cancer, I'll be dissatisfied knowing that I won't be able to finish my life having done all the things I planned to do before I go to the grave. Either way, I know I won't be able to truly live a "full" life if I know how or when I'll die, so I'd much rather just live the way I want to instead of worrying about staying as far from death's door as possible.

BASIC STATISTICS FAIL!
You can't compare absolute numbers of pedestrians killed to cyclists killed, as there FAR more pedestrians than cyclists.
You need to normalise: divide the number of accidents by an estimate of the total amount of time everyone spent doing that thing.

Why is this a problem?
The obvious answer is that cycling is NOT safer, and you just said that it was.
But, worse to me, this video is portrayed as a reputable source of scientific information (in addition to entertainment), and it has a very basic numerical analysis problem.

BASIC STATISTICS MYTH!
The reason the average life expectancy was much lower in the past has WAY more to do with the fact that newborns were much more likely to die before age 5 than it does from people actually living that much longer (of course, people are living longer, but you're misrepresenting the difference)

Most of these statistics are retarded.
Comparing most of these with another makes absolute zero sense.
You'd have to say how many people walk in America and for how long they walk per day vs how many people drive bikes and for how many hours per day.
Or how many hours do humans in America live around dogs, vs how many hours are humans in the vicinity of sharks.
Without that data all of these comparisons are utterly useless and misleading.

An important thing to note about living longer is that its usually more of an extension of the later stages in someones life thanks to the points in the video.

Better medical care has resulted in not dying of flu or falling and breaking bones but instead spending the last 20 or 30 years of life(70 or 80 till 90 or 100) in slow decline at a nursing home or cared for by loved ones. Sometimes this translates to more medical bills and suffering. Just wanted to point out that living longer isnt a direct translation to more productive years of life.

If it wasn't for you, he wouldn't be 3 seconds late of the time, that would occur if you never were there. And say, this car, 3 seconds late decides to run to a red light too, he is mad at you for stopping him, and stops 5 more cars. One of these cars will hit somebody. And, without you, this wouldn't have happened, because +/- 3 seconds from that moment, this guy who got hit by a car could have had time to dodge the car. And this goes for almost every situation there actually is. Whatever somebody does, it will affect the people whom you meet during your lifetime, their schedules and actions, and therefore... Most of your life, most of everyones' life, is going to be just fate.

"Life expectancy" is a measure of infant and maternal mortality. It has very little to do with how old an age an adult will die at. Not sure about the statement "More likely to die walking about in a city than on a bike". Does that take in to account how many people do each activity? An example - if 1,000,000 cycle in a city, but 10,000,000 walk in that city, then 6,200 walking deaths and 900 cycling deaths still means that you're more likely to die cycling in that city if you choose to do so, because 1 in every 1,111 people cycling died, but only 1 in every 1,613 pedestrians died. It's simple mathematics: most people are awake more hours of the day than they are asleep, and so one's likelihood of dying while they're awake is greater than dying while asleep. For example, if on average you sleep 8 hours a day (1/3 of the day), then there is a 33.3% chance that you'll die in your sleep, and a 66.7% chance that you'll die while awake. As such, then the fewer hours you sleep per day on average therefore decreases the likelihood of you dying while asleep. So if you really do wanna die while sleeping, perhaps you should take more naps.

1: the increase in life expectancy is largely due to decreased infant mortality rates.
